designScenario.name: Leading Edge Device System
designScenario.description: The Leading Edge Device System is designed to enhance lift and control during low-speed flight phases, such as takeoff and landing, by modifying the wing's aerodynamic profile. This system deploys leading-edge slats and Krueger flaps to increase the wing's curvature and delay stall, ensuring stable airflow at high angles of attack. It integrates with the aircraft's flight control systems to automate deployment based on flight phase and speed, while prioritizing structural integrity and fail-safe mechanisms.

details.description: Deploy and retract leading-edge devices in response to flight control commands to optimize lift during takeoff, landing, and high-angle-of-attack conditions.
Coordinate device actuation with wing flaps and spoilers for seamless aerodynamic surface management.
Achieve full deployment of leading-edge devices within 3 seconds under normal operating conditions.
Ensure synchronized retraction with minimal lag during transition to cruise configuration.
Implement hydraulic/motor redundancy to maintain partial functionality in case of actuator failure.
Lock devices in neutral position during critical flight phases if system malfunctions.
Withstand repeated cycles of deployment/retraction (≥10,000 cycles) without structural degradation.
Resist icing and moisture ingress through thermal de-icing systems and corrosion-resistant coatings.

systemComponents.name: Leading Edge Slats
systemComponents.description: Retractable devices on the leading edge of the wing that extend to alter airflow and delay stall.

subComponents.name: Slats Actuator Assembly
subComponents.description: Hydraulic/electric actuators that drive slat extension and retraction.

subComponents.name: Track and Guide System
subComponents.description: Guiding rails and bearings enabling smooth slat movement along the wing's leading edge.

systemComponents.name: Krueger Flaps
systemComponents.description: Deployable panels on the wing's leading edge that increase camber for enhanced lift during low-speed flight.

subComponents.name: Krueger Actuation Cylinder
subComponents.description: Linear actuators providing force for flap deployment and retraction.

subComponents.name: Locking Mechanism
subComponents.description: Pneumatic locks securing flaps in deployed or retracted positions.

systemComponents.name: Flight Control Interface Module
systemComponents.description: Electronic unit receiving flight data and issuing deployment commands to leading-edge devices.

relationships.description: The Flight Control Interface Module sends deployment/retraction commands to the Leading Edge Slats.
The Leading Edge Device System aggregates multiple leading-edge slats across the wing's span.
The Leading Edge Device System includes Krueger flaps as a primary subcomponent for high-lift operations.
The Flight Control Interface Module controls Krueger flap actuation based on airspeed and altitude inputs.

attributes.name: actuationSpeed
attributes.description: Maximum time required to fully deploy or retract leading-edge devices.

attributes.name: deflectionAccuracy
attributes.description: Precision of slat/krueger flap angular positioning during deployment.

attributes.name: materialStrength
attributes.value: Aerospace-grade titanium alloys with >1200 MPa yield strength
attributes.description: Structural material specifications ensuring resistance to aerodynamic loads and cyclical stress.

attributes.name: environmentResistance
attributes.value: -54°C to +90°C; ice protection via bleed air
attributes.description: Operational temperature range and ice protection system integration.

attributes.name: cycleEndurance
attributes.description: Expected service life for repeated deployment/retraction cycles without maintenance.
